name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown

reviews.text: What a lovely hotel. We were given a suite, which was absolutely beautiful. The rooms were very spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile. Breakfast was provided at no additional charge and was the best we experienced on a 16 State USA tour.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night here. We got a great deal, it was like $150 and that included valet with in/out privileges ($40) and 2 tkts to the Field Museum ($50).
reviews.title: Great price, great location!

reviews.text: The room is a little on the small side, but it's very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located 2 blocks from Michigan ave. There are no restaurants in the hotel, but there are a bunch of good ones nearby.
reviews.title: Great value!

likes.liked: — Clean and comfortable at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very happy and definitely will look to stay here again in the future.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Fairfield is clean and newly renovated, with an attractive (if minimal) lobby. Free WiFi is available in the lobby and the 2nd-floor breakfast room; I also managed to find some other WiFi from my fifth-floor room. Breakfast is good, as free hotel breakfasts go. If you've got business downtown, the location can't be beat. Very firm and comfortable mattress. Friendly, helpful staff. A great value for the price!
reviews.title: Decent, for the price.

likes.liked: — Many restaurants in the area. Close to the Magnificent Mile and shopping, as well as Navy Pier and also walking distance to the
likes.disliked: — Some of the staff didn't seem to be very service minded.

reviews.text: Staff and service is mediocre and real service hotel wannabes. Front desk not very 'with it.' Upon entrance to room, there was a heavy fragrance odor - like standing next to a person wearing too much perfume/cologne.
reviews.title: Over priced medicore hotel wanting to be something more

reviews.text: Aside from this heavy lingering frangrance, room was clean and average. Free internet access was very handy.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Perfect Location

likes.disliked: — No HGTV and TLC channels on television

reviews.text: Location is excellent blocks from the magnificent mile. Starbucks, Panera and the Corner Bakery are blocks away.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!!!!

likes.liked: — The staff and the maid service
likes.disliked: — Fact they had no rooms available to upgrade us

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet and location were the best things about my stay here.
reviews.title: Great Price , Great service, Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable with new upgraded beds and linens. The rooms are not large and there are no views, but overall very pleasant. Our housekeeper did an excellent job cleaning every day. The breakfast is excellent as other reviewers have said, and there is coffee and tea 24 hours a day.
reviews.title: fantastic breakfast!

reviews.text: I could not find a room in Chicago so I "settled" for the Fairfield Inn on Orchard in downtown, one block off the Magnificent Mile.
reviews.title: Excellent Value and Great Location

reviews.text: The staff was super fast and friendly. The suite was large and very clean. The room was quiet and everything worked. I got a great rate (well under $200) and I will now stay there rather than the more expensive hotels around the corner. I had to give up nothing! A great value and location.
reviews.title: A quiet, convenient basic Marriott hotel that provides a good value

reviews.text: Fairfield Inn properties are generally in less urbanized location, they are more commonly found around town malls than downtown. Thus the Marriott Fairfield Inn and Suites, 216 E. Ontario St., sits rather incongrously in Chicago center city, on a relatively quiet street less than 3 blocks from Chicago's Michigan Avenue in the Magnificent Mile district. Within walking distance are the Chicago River, John Hancock Tower, Navy Pier and shuttle access, Water Tower Place and Millenium Park.
reviews.title: Spacious Room for 4 people

likes.liked: — Size of the room and location

reviews.text: I found the interior to be simple, but clean and well maintained. 1402 overlooks Ontario Street, and does get the noise from the occasional loud vehicle. There is no in-house restaurant, the breakfast self-serve area is healthy and offers good choices. Within a block of the Fairfield are: 1 sub shop; two Japanese restaurants, an Indian restaurant, donut/coffee shop, a high end dinner dining establishment, corner bar and grille and others. So this is a convenient, comfortable, reasonable value hotel in an outstanding area of Chicago.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1402 was a relatively small queen, but well outfitted and suitable for one or two people. As you can tell I liked this property and recommend it. Staff is friendly and outgoing to guests. Valet parking exists but I didn't use it.
reviews.title: Great Place...but

likes.disliked: — Check in staff....the loading dock near our window

reviews.text: My family just returned from our stay at the Fairfield Downtown Chicago. Overall it was very good. The rooms were very clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and helped us several times locate restaurants and bus routes. The location is great if you're wanting to be by the Magnificent Mile. It's only a block away! They don't have a pool, however, will allow you to swim at one of the other Marriotts nearby. The bus system is easy to pick up there. They have free shuttles during the summer, but they're not well organized. There are only a few of them running during the week, so you have to wait a long time. Then, it's iffy if you'll get on because they're not very big. Breakfast was good! They had waffles, cereal, fruit, yogurt, pastries and microwavable sandwiches (bacon, egg and cheese). It was definately more than your average continental breakfast fare.
reviews.title: Good stay at the Fairfield

reviews.text: The hotel was very clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is excellet. Just a short walk to the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, or to a double decker bus stop. I must say however, that what ever frangrence they are using in the lobby, needs to be toned down - the smell of whatever potpourri that was, took my breath away whenever I walked into the lobby.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

likes.liked: — the potpourri smell in the lobby

reviews.title: Location, Price, Location, Price
reviews.text: For the price this hotel is great. We parked our car and was able to walk everywhere from Michigan Ave. to Millenium Park in no time(3-20 min.). I'm very picky when it comes to hotels since it's my home away from home so I am pretty hard when it comes to scrutinizing service and overall quality. In short I usually go no lower than 4 stars so I wasn't sure what I was getting into going here. But hey it was an earned gift, so I figured I would give it a shot.
For the money it gets an A+ on all the following:cleanliness, friendly and accomodating staff, and again location.
reviews.title: rude staff, damaged our suitcases and no redressal as of yet

aka: Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago Downtown Hotel
description: Welcome to our Marriott Flagship Fairfield Inn & Suites Chicago downtown hotel. Our unique, contemporary hotel features 15 stories, located in the heart of the Magnificent Mile, with 185 guestrooms and suites. We are friendly, fun, but yet down to business. We provide a comfortable, affordable oasis in Chicago’s Downtown. All rooms include breakfast and high speed Wi-Fi Internet. We are one of the closest hotels to Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue shopping.
